contentrichtext.text: {{Taxobox | name = Zenionidae | image = Zenion hololepis.jpg | image_width = 240px | image_caption = ''[[Zenion hololepis]]'' | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordata]] | classis = [[Actinopterygii]] | ordo = [[Zeiformes]] | familia = '''Zenionidae''' | familia_authority = [[George S. Myers|G. S. Myers]], 1960 | subdivision_ranks = Genera<ref>{{FishBase family | family = Zeionidae| month = October | year = 2012}}</ref> | subdivision = ''[[Capromimus]]''<br> ''[[Cyttomimus]]''<br/> ''[[Zenion]]'' }} The '''Zenionidae''' are a [[family (biology)|family]] of large, showy, deep-bodied [[zeiform]] marine [[fish]]. Found in the [[Atlantic Ocean|Atlantic]], [[Indian Ocean|Indian]], and [[Pacific Ocean]], the family contains just seven [[species]] in three [[genus|genera]]. The family was formerly known as '''Macrurocyttidae'''. == References == {{reflist}} [[Category:Zeionidae]]
